title: Brock Lesnar attacked by UFC legend Cain Velasquez after he wins WWE title
text:
The video will start in 8 Cancel

Brock Lesnar was turned upside down as UFC legend Cain Velasquez attacked the new WWE champion in a shocking debut on Friday Night Smackdown.

Just moments after ‘The Beast Incarnate’ dethroned Kofi Kingston within 10 seconds to become Smackdown’s new king, Velasquez stunned the crowd and stormed to the ring to beat down the man he defeated for the UFC heavyweight championship nine years ago.

The 37-year-old has moved into wrestling after enjoying a stint earlier this year in Mexico’s popular Lucha Underground series.

And now it appears his future lies in WWE after he was accompanied by the iconic Rey Mysterio.

The WWE great and his son Dominick were victims of a heinous in-ring assault by Lesnar during last Monday’s Raw.

Lesnar brutally laid out both Mysterio and his teenage son.

But his actions were met with consequences as Velasquez made his surprise entrance to the world of WWE and delivered a barrage of blows to Lesnar, before the newly-crowned WWE champion managed to escape.

It could now set up an exciting fresh rivalry between to the two behemoths.

And it concluded what was a dramatic beginning to the newly launched Friday Night Smackdown on America’s Fox Network.

Hollywood superstar The Rock made his return to the show he help christen 20 years ago - and delivered his signature Rock Bottom on Baron Corbin.

And the lineal heavyweight boxing champion of the world Tyson Fury was also involved on the night as he jumped the barricade in an attempt to square up to the ‘Monster Among Men’ Braun Strowman.

Around 20 security guards stepped in to control Fury inside the Staples Center in LA after he was left angered by Strowman confronting him at ringside before launching fellow wrestler Dolph Ziggler into Fury’s lap.

It could set up an interesting angle for Fury within the world of sports entertainment ahead of his world title showdown with Deontay Wilder early next year.

Meanwhile on Smackdown, ‘The Fiend’ Bray Wyatt made his presence felt again as he attacked Universal champion Seth Rollins once again.

The pair will battle inside the demonic Hell in Cell structure at Sunday’s aptly-named pay-per-view, Hell in a Cell.

You can follow live updates of that on Mirror Sport.
description: Lesnar beat Kofi Kingston in 10 seconds but then fled the ring after Velasquez took him down in shock WWE debut - and it could set up an exciting rivalry
